name: La Quinta Inn Cocoa Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hotel for the price... a few minutes walk to the beach.. staff was always helpfull and friendly.. rooms were very clean and beds were comfy.. a/c was cold... pool with an outside Tiki Bar
reviews.title: Nice Stay

reviews.text: I actually got this hotel at a steep discount and was a little leary after booking it. I was very pleasantly surprised by this hotel! Upon checking in the people at the front desk had fresh cookies waiting for us! Everyone was very friendly and accommodating. The tv was not working but they had someone in to fix it right away.. Kudos to the maintenance guy he was very helpful and friendly and gave my friend and I some tips on what to do/where to eat in the area.
reviews.title: Pleasant Surprise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The free wireless internet was great, the hotel was easy to find and amenities were great for the price I paid. There was a continental breakfast which wasn't great but it was free so that's all that matters!
reviews.title: Great Value and a Lovely Stay

reviews.text: Beds were comfy and everything was free! I would not mind staying here again and it actually made me consider the chain for future travel to other locations.
reviews.title: Great Service and very clean rooms.

reviews.text: We had a really good time at the La Quinta Inn. This is a motel style inn and our room was on the ground floor facing the car park with external access. The room was a good size and very clean and quiet. The bed was big and comfortable. The air conditioning was a little noisy but ever so efficient and so we turned it off at night without any discomfort. We had no cause to trouble the staff but they seemed friendly and helpful. The complimentary breakfast was generous with lots of choice. The pool was clean and great to bask beside. All in all a perfect base from which to explore the local area and Orlando. Heartily recommended.
reviews.title: Excellent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: THIS REVIEW IS FOR THE LA QUINTA OCEANFRONT HOTEL ON HENDRY AVENUE (there is another La Quinta Inn in Cocoa Beach).
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: This is a great hotel for the price. We stayed in an oceanfront room, which has a great view of the Atlantic Ocean. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are very nice with above-average amenties in the rooms. The hotel is right next to the Cocoa Beach Pier, so you can do a lot without ever moving your car. Our room was right on the beachfront.
reviews.title: Terrible

reviews.text: The price is right, but check your credit card statement. We went as two couples and each couple had their own room. The other couple had booked both rooms on his credit card, but we paid seperately when we checked out. Both rooms ended up being charged on one of the cards instead of seperately. I am nearly certain that it was an honest mistake by the staff.
reviews.title: Good hotel - Good Park and Cruise Value

reviews.text: I do not understand how the reviews on this hotel seemed positive. We checked in this past Wed. night prior to a cruise. We did not arrive until 11:00, and maybe we got one of the bad rooms. It was on the first floor. The hotel is very old, the room was damp and while it looked ok in the night, the light of day was a different story. There were multiple stains on the carpet where water had seeped in from outside. I got up in the middle of the night to go to the bathroom and killed 3 cock roaches in there. I then left that light on and turned on the other lights in the room to keep the bugs away. The breakfast was horrible, we ended up no even eating. There were old waffles stuck to the waffle maker. there were no pastries in the pastry holder, the bagels were hard as a rock. We finally gave up and left.
reviews.title: Old and ant ridden hotel in crappy area

reviews.text: I would not recommend staying here. The price was cheap and the reviews I read seemed fine, but it was a different story. Maybe we got a bad room, but I can say for sure, the room we stayed in was not worth the money we paid.
reviews.title: WONDERFUL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice motel, Outside a lil' dated. Inside very nice for the price. Slept great on the King size bed, the fridge and microwave came in handy as well. Breakfast was GREAT! Even called for a late checkout and they gave me until 2pm. Only downside is you have to cross the road to get to the beach but it isn't terrible for the savings. I'll be back!
reviews.title: Nice affordable stay with perks

reviews.text: I recently took my group to a competition in Cocoa Beach. I did my homework and selected the La Quinta- (not the one by the pier - there are 2 in Cocoa) Yes the place was old - almost all of them are old! But this one was clean, the rooms are all modern with all the amenities, fridge, mircowave, tv, heated pool, with towels and did I say clean!!!!! We booked 30 rooms and there was not one disappointed person in our group!! No matter why you stay here, know this: the owner operated staff was super nice, the breakfast was unbeatable - they had everything hot and cold and all included in the price, and the price was great!! I would recommend this hotel to anyone- especially those with kids!! There were great restaurants, stores and supermarkets close by and it was a short walk to the magnificent beach. Stay here- you won't regret it!
reviews.title: CLEAN, AFFORDABLE & FRIENDLY!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I specifically called about the park and ride for the cruise ships. They assured me, "They parking is free, the ride to/from the ship is free, and we have our own van and take you whenever you are ready." We get there, and the snooty guy behind the desk informs me that none of this is correct, we will be charged individually for the ride to/from, and the van ONLY leaves at 11:30 am. (no exceptions). This blows our plans for the Kennedy Space Tour, so we just pay the cruise parking- oh well. At this point, it's not about the money. I just don't like being lied to. Lesson learned- go somewhere else. There are too many other reputable place to stay and TRUST in Cocoa Beach.
reviews.title: They LIED to me!

reviews.text: As noted in previous reviews this motel is not ocean front. But if you are leaving on a cruise as we were it is great for a one night stay. It is very close to the port and the breakfast is very good before you leave for the cruise terminal. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable, which is all we needed. It is a motel and it is older. We stayed in the back building which was a little loud due to some younger guests and since it is a motel you can hear everything going on in the parking lot. Great value for a one night stay and just what you need if you are leaving on a cruise.
reviews.title: Great Value before you leave on a cruise
There are two La Quinta's in Cocoa Beach.
reviews.text: Just so you know, this is not the La Quinta by the pier (Hendry Ave.) This one is right on N. Atlantic Ave. Several reviews here are clearly for the other hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I chose this hotel based on my budget and I got an OK room for what i could afford. Other hotels I would have liked were either booked or too pricey and I really didn't need to be right on the beach. The best thing was the short walk/drive to the Lori Wilson where there was ample parking and easy access to a beach with restrooms.
reviews.title: Just OK

reviews.text: We came and parked there a week later for the shuttle launch (a bit far away but a nice day at the beach).
reviews.title: PreCruise, excellent deal!!
Very pleasantly surprised!
reviews.text: Check in was not very welcoming and the guy at the desk was abrupt and maybe a little "grubby". Complimentary breakfast was adequate and helpful. You could walk to Denny's if you wanted more.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a ground level room with outside access which is not my favorite but it did prove to be relatively quiet even though a Harley parked next to our car.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: I have photos of every other hotel on our two week trip but somehow forgot at this place.
reviews.title: Great Stay!!!!

aka: La Quinta Inn Cocoa Beach Hotel
